film.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a story that is told using sound and moving pictures, shown at a cinema or on television
film.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Have you seen any good films recently?
a film about a young dancer
film.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: moving pictures of real events that are shown on television or at a cinema
film.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: the race to be first with film footage (=pictures) of news events
film.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: the work of making films, considered as an art or a business
film.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: I’m interested in photography and film.
a background in film and animation
film.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the thin plastic used in a camera for taking photographs or recording moving pictures
film.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: I shot five rolls of film on vacation.
The whole incident was recorded on film.
film.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a very thin layer of liquid, powder etc on the surface of something
film.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: a film of oil on the surface of the water
film.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: He stayed in and watched a film on TV.

a big-budget film aimed at the mass market

a European film company trying to compete with the major Hollywood studios

This year’s festival includes a tribute to the French film director Bertrand Tavernier.

He is one of several exciting young film makers.

In 'La Strada', Nino Rota demonstrates the poetic power of film music.

film.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to use a camera to record a story or real events so that they can be shown in the cinema or on television
film.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The love scenes are sensitively filmed.
She’s in South Africa filming a documentary for the BBC.
a thriller filmed entirely on location in Washington
